attributes.action: REQUEST THANET DISTRICT COUNCIL TO REVERSE DECISION TO CHANGE FOR CLINICAL WASTE
attributes.background: I’m getting a letter asking for payment for disposing of my sharp bin ( I’m Diabetic type 1 ) it’s made me feel that I’m being penalised for having a illness and being responsible person for not throwing my needles in a bin and I would think any person that needs this service feels the same

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This decision is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here:

https://www.thanet.gov.uk/your-services/how-do-we-make-decisions/how-can-i-have-my-say/petitions/
